page.title: 01Newent Town and Surroundings
page.content: The block contains approximately half of the town of{Newent}and extends into the surrounding countryside to the north and east. The town is old and is mentioned in the Domesday Book as{'Noent'}(New- Place)It is 9 miles west of Gloucester and is the social centre for north -west Gloucestershire. Once a market town, it retains much of the character of its early days, with a long main street bordered with half-timbered and old brick buildings. In recent years modern housing estates have been built reflecting the now mainly residential nature of the Town whose population in 1985 is nearly 5000. To the north the countryside is noted for its light soil and horticultural industry while to the east are medium sized traditional mixed farms and the village of Upleadon.
